definition: to land/to touch the ground/also pr. [zhuo2 di4]
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Floor bridge. Lie on your back with legs bent and your feet flat on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 背部着地平躺，两腿弯曲，脚平放在地上。

sentences.english: You’d think an animal that hops would know how to land.
sentences.chinese: 你一定认为会跳的动物就知道如何着地。

sentences.english: Julia said, raking the ground. “Yeh can call me Elina if you’d like.”
sentences.chinese: “茱莉亚刨着地说，”你也可以叫我艾琳娜。”

sentences.english: It has a ghoul in the attic and gnomes in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 陋居的阁楼上有食尸鬼，花园里住着地精。

sentences.english: Face first touchdown, no turning back.
Sit on the ground with your feet on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 练习者坐于地面，两脚着地。

sentences.english: Then stand up and do some knee raises and toe touches.
sentences.chinese: 然后站起来足尖着地做一些曲膝动作。

sentences.english: Then kneel, resting one knee on the floor.
Medical and science community seriously talk about "cushioning" by landing on the heel.
sentences.chinese: 医学和科学组织不无严肃地提及脚后跟着地时的缓冲。

sentences.english: P: I fell at land on my arm.
My knee is locked and my heel is striking the ground.
sentences.chinese: 我的膝盖锁死，正用脚跟着地。

sentences.english: On this day he took a near fatal drop on his head.
sentences.chinese: 就在这一天，他跳落时头部着地，命悬一线。

sentences.english: You don't have to break your neck fixing this TV set, I really don't need it next week.
sentences.chinese: 你不必急着地修这个电视机，我下星期并不需要它。

sentences.english: And on this day, she lands every stunt.
sentences.chinese: 这天，她每次着地动作都很漂亮。

sentences.english: Lie flat on your back. Bring one leg up to a 90-degree angle and hold.
sentences.chinese: 背部着地平躺，一条腿向上升呈90度，保持住。

sentences.english: The heel of the shoe is bigger and heavier than other parts of the shoe, sowhichisitwould seem more likelycalmtocome down first.
sentences.chinese: 鞋的跟部比其它地方要大，且重，所以更易先着地。

definition: to step on/to tread on/to wear (shoes)/(slang) to dump (sb)/Taiwan pr. [deng4]
